_prev_prog_3.EquipmentTested: V-364R1, Purge Compressor Suction Knock-out Drum

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
This is a five-year update.  Changes contained in this Plan include an update to the five-year accident history, and inclusion a chemical previously not included in the RMPlan.

1. Accidental release prevention and emergency response policies: Huntsman Polymers Odessa is committed to providing a safe, healthy, and environmentally conscious work place for its employees and neighbors.  This is exemplified by Huntsman Odessa having earned OSHA VPP STAR status and ISO 14001 certification.  The Huntsman Odessa facility maintains a working PSM program, which implements a series of steps to prevent potential hazards associated with the process and assures a well-trained workforce.  The PSM program further implements its policies with onsite procedures and manuals.  Huntsman Polymers Odessa participates with community agencies to develop emergency response plans and participates in cooperative training with these agencies.  Since its certification in January 1993, the Odessa Site has been an active participant in the International Standards Organization (ISO) 9002 quality management program.

2. Regulated Substances: Huntsman Polymers Odessa is located in Odessa, Texas.  The Odessa site operates five Program Level 3 processes.  These processes receive, handle, and store flammable hydrocarbon feedstocks for the production of olefins and specialty grade polymers.  End uses include medical and personal care products, electronic cable coatings, adhesives and sealants, as well as boat and vehicle trims.  Huntsman's Odessa site has large volumes of several regulated flammable substances, such as ethane, ethylene, propane, propylene, butane, and butene.  The Odessa site uses small volumes of toxic chemicals, which are consumed in the process.  The toxic chemicals are:
- Chlorine - Used for water treatment.
- Vinyl Acetate - Used as a comonomer in the manufacturing of polyethylene.
- Hydrochloric Acid - Used for water treatment. 

4. General Accidental Release Prevention Program an

d Chemical Specific Prevention Steps: Following is a brief summary of the elements that Huntsman's Odessa Site has implemented to comply with the accidental release prevention requirements outlined by EPA as well as with the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) standard.

PROCESS SAFETY INFORMATION

Huntsman's Odessa site maintains a compilation of current and accurate written safety information to identify and understand the hazards of the process.  This includes information pertaining to:
- Hazards of regulated substances: For each regulated substance, there is a Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS).
- The technology of the process: Includes a discussion of process chemistry, process temperature and pressure, and chemical reactivity.
- Equipment in the process: Includes such information as materials of construction, diagrams of the piping and instrumentation, safety systems, and design codes.

PROCESS HAZARD ANALYSIS

Huntsman's Odessa site has performed a process hazard analysis on each process to identify potential hazards, adequacy of the engineering and administrative controls, and ways to minimize those hazards.  Huntsman Odessa utilizes the HAZOP  and What-if/Checklist methodologies, recognized and generally accepted methods for identifying and evalualting hazards in the process.  The Odessa site assigns associates to the HAZOP team who are knowledgeable in the HAZOP methodology and the specific process.  The HAZOP team develops recommendations to reduce the potential hazards which, if approved, are implemented within a reasonable period of time.

OPERATING PROCEDURES

Huntsman Odessa maintains written operating procedures that were developed with the operators to provide clear instruction for safely conducting activities associated with a covered process.  The procedures address steps for all operating phases, safety systems, control measures and precautions to prevent exposures to process hazards.  The procedure

man Odessa employs a hot work permit program for hot work operations conducted on or near a covered process.  If any hot work is performed near a covered process, a hot work permit is issued that documents fire prevention and protection requirements for the operation, dates and times authorized for the hot work, and object on which the work is to be performed.  Hot work permits are kept on file until the work is complete.  

CONTRACTORS

Huntsman Odessa has developed procedures and policies for selecting and ensuring contractors are competent,  knowledgeable and can safely perform their work.  Huntsman Odessa provides information to them about hazards associated with their work environment and has developed appropriate safe work practices.  Huntsman Odessa also evaluates the safety programs and performances of contractors as a part of their continued employment. 

5. Five Year Accident History: Huntsman Odessa has two accidental releases to report for the five-year accident history.  On October 31, 2001, an ethylene/propane release resulted in one on-site injury.  There was no fire, explosion, or property damage.  There were no off-site consequences resulting in deaths, injuries, evacuations, shelter-in-place warnings, property damage, or environmental impact.  On March 16, 2004, there was a release of a flammable gas mixture from an underground storage well.  For reporting purposes, the release was quantified over a four-day period.  For emergency response purposes, the release was only six hours in duration.  The initial response for the incident included the closure of several major roads in the immediate area.  There were no on-site or off-site injuries or deaths.

6. Emergency Response Program:  Huntsman Odessa has a written emergency response program that contains procedures to be followed in case of an accidental release.  These procedures include steps for informing local emergency response agencies and the public.  In addition, Huntsman Odessa provides trai

s are reviewed and revised periodically to ensure their accuracy and completeness.

TRAINING

Huntsman Odessa provides initial training as well as refresher training to associates to assure the required level of skills and knowledge are maintained.  The training emphasizes safety and health hazards, emergency operations, and safe work practices.  All operators receive refresher training in accordance with applicable standards.

MECHANICAL INTEGRITY

Huntsman Odessa has developed written procedures for maintaining the operating components of the process (including pressure vessels, storage tanks, piping systems, relief and vent systems, emergency shutdown system controls, and pumps) through the mechanical integrity program.  The program is comprised of well-trained personnel who follow maintenance, testing, and inspection procedures that ensure proper function of process equipment.

MANAGEMENT OF CHANGE

Huntsman Odessa has established and implemented written procedures to manage changes to process chemicals, technology, equipment, procedures, and any changes to the facility that affect a covered process.  The procedures assure that prior to any change, the following issues are considered: the technical basis for the proposed change, its impact on safety, health, and the environment, any modifications to operating procedures, the necessary time period for the change, and any authorization requirements.  Associates involved in operating a process, as well as maintenance and contract associates whose job will be affected, are informed of and trained in the change.  If necessary, the process safety information and operating procedures are updated.

PRE-STARTUP SAFETY REVIEW

Huntsman Odessa performs pre-startup safety reviews when the addition of or a modification to the facility is made that is significant enough to require a change in the process safety information.  The pre-startup safety review confirms, prior to the introduction of highly hazardous chemicals, that

construction and equipment is in accordance with design specifications: safety, operating, maintenance and emergency procedures are in place; management of change requirements are met; and training of associates affected by the modification is complete.

COMPLIANCE AUDIT

Huntsman Odessa performs audits of its compliance with provisions of its process safety management program.  Teams comprised of associates, with appropriate knowledge of audit techniques, process safety and operating experience, conduct audits every three years to verify the procedures and practices developed are adequate and being followed.  The findings of the audit team are reviewed and tracked until resolved.

INCIDENT INVESTIGATION

Huntsman Odessa investigates any incidents that resulted in, or could possibly have resulted in, a catastrophic release of covered chemicals.  The investigation is promptly conducted, commencing within 48 hours of any incident.  To perform the investigation, Huntsman Odessa utilizes a team consiting of persons with the appropriate knowledge and experience to thoroughly investigate and analyze the incident.  A report is prepared at the conclusion of the incident investigation that address the incident, the factors that contributed to it, and recommendations resulting from the investigation.  Huntsman Odessa establishhed a system to promptly address and resolve the incident report findings, recommendations, and to document their resolution.  Finally, incident reports are reviewed with all affected personnel.

EMPLOYEE PARTICIPATION

Huntsman Odessa has developed a written action plan for associate participation in all aspects of its process safety management program.  Huntsman Odessa consults with associates on the conduction and development of PHA's and on development of the other elements of the process safety management program.  Huntsman Odessa ensures all associates have access to PHA's and all other process safety management information.

HOT WORK PERMIT

Hunts

ning to its emergency response associates and to local emergency responders who may be called upon to assist in emergency response.  Huntsman Odessa participates with the Ector County Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) to develop emergency response procedures that identify resources, chemicals, contracts, and material safety data sheets for participating companies.  Other community activities include cooperative training between the Odessa site and the Odessa Fire Department, as well as making available equipment, technical information, personnel, and supplies for county mutual aid.  The emergency response management plan and its procedures are reveiwed periodically and updated as necessary.  Likewise, the emergency response equipment is maintained, tested, and inspected in accordance with prescribed standards.

7. Planned changes to improve safety:  Huntsman Odessa has an on-going commitment to improve safety, health, and to protect the environment.  In addition to frequently scheduled internal company audits and inspections, the site undergoes an annual self-evaluation as part of the American Chemistry Council (ACC) Responsible Care process safety codes and OSHA's Voluntary Protection Program (VPP).  Improving safety is a continuing process at Huntsman, and a number of significant safety improvements have been made.  Recent safety improvements include:

- Routing additional Pressure Safety Valves to a flare system.
- Installation of additional gas detection systems.
- Installation of distributed control systems.
- Installation of additional automatic emergency isolation valves. 
- Installation of additional sprinkler systems.

The following safety, health, and environmental improvements are anticipated during the next five years:

- Completion of new fire water loop to south well storage area.
- Upgrade gas detection systems plant-wide.
- Upgrade of exisiting flare system.
- Improvements to the fire water distribution system.
- Upgrades to existing fire fig
